headline.print_headline: Subway Line Meets an Obstruction: Beverly Hills High School
headline.seo: Subway Line Under Beverly Hills High Faces Roadblock
headline.main: Subway Line Meets an Obstruction: Beverly Hills High School

docs.snippet: The Metropolitan Transportation Authority of Los Angeles in May approved a nine-mile stretch of a project, at a cost of $5.6 billion, that would run under the high school campus....
docs.abstract: Residents of Beverly Hills, Calif, have gone to court to block the proposed Subway to the Sea line from burrowing under the high school, which is celebrated for its roster of famous graduates and its ZIP code; suit contends that the tunnel poses a safety threat to students, but tensions have resurfaced between school officials and transit advocates, bringing to the surface, unfairly, Beverly Hills residents say, old charges that the community does not want to open its borders to mass transit.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Metropolitan Transportation Authority of Los Angeles in May approved a nine-mile stretch of a project, at a cost of $5.6 billion, that would run under the high school campus.

headline.print_headline: Bracing for Big Traffic Jam That Didn’t Come on Day 1
headline.seo: Alexander Hamilton Bridge Construction Has Drivers Bracing for Worst
headline.main: Bracing for Big Traffic Jam That Didn’t Come on Day 1

docs.snippet: Construction on the Alexander Hamilton Bridge had motorists prepared for the worst on Sunday, with many using different routes into New York City....
docs.abstract: Traffic seems to flow normally on the Alexander Hamilton Bridge, which connects Manhattan and the Bronx over the Harlem River, despite construction that had motorists prepared for horrendous traffic jams on the George Washington Bridge; restoration of the bridge, budgeted at more than $400 million, is expected to continue through the end of 2013.
docs.lead_paragraph: Construction on the Alexander Hamilton Bridge had motorists prepared for the worst on Sunday, with many using different routes into New York City.

headline.print_headline: A Challenge That Is the Stuff of Legends
headline.seo: 2012 British Open — Course Is Test of a Champion
headline.main: A Challenge That Is the Stuff of Legends

docs.snippet: Since the world rankings have been established, every winner at Royal Lytham & St. Annes, the site of this year’s British Open, has at some point been the No. 1 player in the world....

keywords.value: Royal Lytham & St Annes Golf Club
keywords.name: organizations

docs.abstract: Course at Royal Lytham & St Annes Golf Club, site of the British Open, is unusually difficult; every player who has won at the course has at some point been No 1 in the world, which cannot be said about any other site of the British Open that has hosted the event more than once.
docs.lead_paragraph: Since the world rankings have been established, every winner at Royal Lytham & St. Annes, the site of this year’s British Open, has at some point been the No. 1 player in the world.

docs.snippet: A civil rights case exposes years of abuses against Latinos in Arizona....
docs.abstract: Editorial welcomes class-action civil-rights suit brought against Maricopa County, Ariz, Sheriff Joe Arpaio, by the American Civil Liberties Union and others, accusing him of waging an all-out, unlawful campaign of discrimination and harassment against Latinos and those who look like them; contends that trial will expose years of abuses conducted under the aegis of Arizona's immigration law, including illegal stops, searches and arrests that provoked widespread fear among citizens.
docs.lead_paragraph: A civil rights case exposes years of abuses against Latinos in Arizona.

docs.snippet: There’s a lot of tut-tutting about the focus on Mitt Romney’s personal history. But it’s not a diversion; it’s a way to bring real policy issues to the forefront....
docs.abstract: Paul Krugman Op-Ed column contends that Pres Obama's attacks on Mitt Romney's personal history, including his time at Bain Capital, are a legitimate way to bring his economically polarizing policies to the forefront; notes that shoddy media coverage has obscured the fact that Romney's policies would favor his wealthy peers with lavish tax cuts and other benefits.
docs.lead_paragraph: There’s a lot of tut-tutting about the focus on Mitt Romney’s personal history. But it’s not a diversion; it’s a way to bring real policy issues to the forefront.

docs.snippet: The slogans and scare stories have taken over the discussion. The Affordable Care Act is humane, fiscally viable and Democrats should be out there defending it....

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.abstract: Bill Keller Op-Ed column contends that the Affordable Care Act is a humane and fiscally viable program, and that slogans and scare tactics have hijacked the national debate about its merits; argues that Democrats should become more confrontational in defending the law, and should no longer allow Republicans to frame it in the public eye.
docs.lead_paragraph: The slogans and scare stories have taken over the discussion. The Affordable Care Act is humane, fiscally viable and Democrats should be out there defending it.

docs.snippet: The pledge of Grover Norquist may have been a useful campaign tool, but it is powerless to prevent automatic tax increases and failed to restrain past spending....
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Sen Tom Coburn rejects notion that Republican lawmakers are thralls to antitax lobbyist Grover G Norquist, contending that they have repeatedly rejected his strict interpretation of the no-new-taxes pledge; contends that Norquist's uncompromising views about taxation have caused him to become isolated, and that Democrats should stop using him as a political boogeyman
docs.lead_paragraph: The pledge of Grover Norquist may have been a useful campaign tool, but it is powerless to prevent automatic tax increases and failed to restrain past spending.
